name: Cuartel de Santo Domingo
description: Cuartel de Santo Domingo is dubbed as the Intramuros or the Santa Rosa Forth Santiago. The fort was built in 1877 and served as the headquarters of Guardia civil to protect the town against bandits. During the revolution period, the Spanish have used this forth against the army of Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo in 1897. During the Japanese occupation, it becomes a refugee camp from Cabuyao and Calamba. Later, it is used by the Philippine Army in 1957. In 1992, it is now used by the Philippine National Police and still preserving some of its ruins.
commute: Getting into this area is takes some rides. First, go to Balibago Complex (bus terminal) and find a tricycle terminal near Target Mall or at Victory Mall and ask the driver to drop you at Santa Rosa Nuvalli. Then, take a walk or ride another tricycle to reach the site.
address: Brgy. Sto Domingo, Santa Rosa, Laguna
